'Ethylene glycol' (IUPAC name: ethane-1,2-diol) is an organic compound widely
used as an automotive antifreeze and a precursor to polymers. In its pure form,
it is an odorless, colorless, syrupy, sweet-tasting liquid. Ethylene glycol is
toxic, and ingestion can result in death.
